Few of us have ever been
caught without nap or two in
our lives. A nap, rather a light
sleep, is sometimes called cat
nap. We have enjoyed a snooze
or a doze at the most opportune
or inopportune times.


Mapping by some is a practiced
art. Some men and women, boys
and girls. are endowed with spe-
cial abilities to sneak maps In
class, at church, In the movies,
and even on city buses.


The term nap, also means to
trim the wool or brush the hair.
The term nap was added to kid
TO form a name of an act Of
stealing a person. Kidnapping is
not a popular crime, especially
since federal authorities will be
called.


Earlier this year rare crime,
cactus plant mapping, was re-
corded in the state. The cacti
nappers we're apprehended and
sent to Jail.


Stories of dognappers have
been told and retold. Often the
CANNES stolen are of registered
breed, however, a few Of ques-
tionable ancestry have been stol-
en-, too.


An article in a recent issue
of a New York City paper re-
vealed the most unusual type Of
stealing. No, diamond thieves
were not baking giant pies to hide
their loot. No, a safecracker did
not stay in bank vault over
night. No, guess again. Do you
give7


Nanny nappers are on the proWl
in Central Park. Women watch
nursemaids bring their charges
in the park and after several
DAYS the women offer the nannies
higher pay and fewer children.


Instead of the employers warn
ing the nurses to watch the chill
dren in the park--the children
had better watch their nannies.


Only in America would you
ever hear about real live cact1-
nappers. But, for our women to
stoop to nanny mapping

another Negro is the victina, or on the other
hand, the attacke
